next.name: The Finest Lady in the Land

segments.pli: Saṃyutta Nikāya 47
segments.en: Linked Discourses 47

segments.pli: 2. Nālandavagga
segments.en: 2. At Nālandā

segments.pli: 19. Sedakasutta
segments.en: 19. At Sedaka

segments.pli: Ekaṃ samayaṃ bhagavā sumbhesu viharati sedakaṃ nāma sumbhānaṃ nigamo.
segments.en: At one time the Buddha was staying in the land of the Sumbhas, near the town of the Sumbhas called Sedaka.

segments.pli: Tatra kho bhagavā bhikkhū āmantesi:
segments.en: There the Buddha addressed the mendicants:

segments.pli: “bhūtapubbaṃ, bhikkhave, caṇḍālavaṃsiko caṇḍālavaṃsaṃ ussāpetvā medakathālikaṃ antevāsiṃ āmantesi:
segments.en: “Once upon a time, mendicants, an acrobat set up his bamboo pole and said to his apprentice Medakathālikā,

segments.pli: ‘ehi tvaṃ, samma medakathālike, caṇḍālavaṃsaṃ abhiruhitvā mama uparikhandhe tiṭṭhāhī’ti.
segments.en: ‘Come now, dear Medakathālikā, climb up the bamboo pole and stand on my shoulders.’

segments.pli: ‘Evaṃ, ācariyā’ti kho, bhikkhave, medakathālikā antevāsī caṇḍālavaṃsikassa paṭissutvā caṇḍālavaṃsaṃ abhiruhitvā ācariyassa uparikhandhe aṭṭhāsi.
segments.en: ‘Yes, teacher,’ she replied. She climbed up the bamboo pole and stood on her teacher’s shoulders.

segments.pli: Atha kho, bhikkhave, caṇḍālavaṃsiko medakathālikaṃ antevāsiṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: Then the acrobat said to Medakathālikā,

segments.pli: ‘tvaṃ, samma medakathālike, mamaṃ rakkha, ahaṃ taṃ rakkhissāmi.
segments.en: ‘You look after me, dear Medakathālikā, and I’ll look after you.

segments.pli: Evaṃ mayaṃ aññamaññaṃ guttā aññamaññaṃ rakkhitā sippāni ceva dassessāma, lābhañca lacchāma, sotthinā ca caṇḍālavaṃsā orohissāmā’ti.
segments.en: That’s how, guarding and looking after each other, we’ll display our skill, collect our fee, and get down safely from the bamboo pole.’

segments.pli: Evaṃ vutte, bhikkhave, medakathālikā antevāsī caṇḍālavaṃsikaṃ etadavoca:
segments.en: When he said this, Medakathālikā said to her teacher,

segments.pli: ‘na kho panetaṃ, ācariya, evaṃ bhavissati.
segments.en: ‘That’s not how it is, teacher!

segments.pli: Tvaṃ, ācariya, attānaṃ rakkha, ahaṃ attānaṃ rakkhissāmi.
segments.en: You should look after yourself, and I’ll look after myself.

segments.pli: Evaṃ mayaṃ attaguttā attarakkhitā sippāni ceva dassessāma, lābhañca lacchāma, sotthinā ca caṇḍālavaṃsā orohissāmā’”ti.
segments.en: That’s how, guarding and looking after ourselves, we’ll display our skill, collect our fee, and get down safely from the bamboo pole.’

segments.pli: “So tattha ñāyo”ti bhagavā etadavoca, “yathā medakathālikā antevāsī ācariyaṃ avoca.
segments.en: That’s the way,” said the Buddha. “It’s just as Medakathālikā said to her teacher.

segments.pli: Attānaṃ, bhikkhave, rakkhissāmīti satipaṭṭhānaṃ sevitabbaṃ;
segments.en: Thinking ‘I’ll look after myself,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: paraṃ rakkhissāmīti satipaṭṭhānaṃ sevitabbaṃ.
segments.en: Thinking ‘I’ll look after others,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Attānaṃ, bhikkhave, rakkhanto paraṃ rakkhati, paraṃ rakkhanto attānaṃ rakkhati.
segments.en: Looking after yourself, you look after others; and looking after others, you look after yourself.

segments.pli: Kathañca, bhikkhave, attānaṃ rakkhanto paraṃ rakkhati?
segments.en: And how do you look after others by looking after yourself?

segments.pli: Āsevanāya, bhāvanāya, bahulīkammena—
segments.en: By development, cultivation, and practice of meditation.

segments.pli: evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, attānaṃ rakkhanto paraṃ rakkhati.
Kathañca, bhikkhave, paraṃ rakkhanto attānaṃ rakkhati?
segments.en: And how do you look after yourself by looking after others?

segments.pli: Khantiyā, avihiṃsāya, mettacittatāya, anudayatāya—
segments.en: By acceptance, harmlessness, love, and sympathy.

segments.pli: evaṃ kho, bhikkhave, paraṃ rakkhanto attānaṃ rakkhati.
Attānaṃ, bhikkhave, rakkhissāmīti satipaṭṭhānaṃ sevitabbaṃ;
segments.en: Thinking ‘I’ll look after myself,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: paraṃ rakkhissāmīti satipaṭṭhānaṃ sevitabbaṃ.
segments.en: Thinking ‘I’ll look after others,’ you should cultivate mindfulness meditation.

segments.pli: Attānaṃ, bhikkhave, rakkhanto paraṃ rakkhati, paraṃ rakkhanto attānaṃ rakkhatī”ti.
segments.en: Looking after yourself, you look after others; and looking after others, you look after yourself.”

segments.pli: Navamaṃ.

suttaplex.blurb: Two acrobats discuss whether one should support the other, or the other way around. The Buddha says they should support each other. In the same way we should practice the four kinds of mindfulness meditation both for one’s own benefit and to protect others.
